text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the T-shirt with a different outfit would be considered a copyright violation in Italy (as a derivative work). The candidate answer explicitly states under the section 'Shirt 1 \u2014 The character in a different outfit with crazy sunglasses:' that 'This is almost certainly infringing. Under Italian copyright law, a cartoon character can be protected as a distinct artistic work when it has sufficiently distinctive features. Changing the outfit and adding sunglasses does not create a new, independent work \u2014 it is a modification (elaborazione) of the original under Article 4 of the Italian Copyright Law.' This directly satisfies the requirement by identifying the violation as an unauthorized modification/derivative work under Italian law.", "criterion_id": "2d540ecf-880a-4df6-8b5a-d31b31a03448"}
